info.title: Freestyle Sandboxes
info.description:
Freestyle Sandboxes lets you deploy your users or AIs code. **Get your API Key at [admin.freestyle.sh](https://admin.freestyle.sh)**

They are broken up into core 5 categories: [Web](#tag/web), [Execute](#tag/execute), [Cloudstate](#tag/cloudstate), [Git](#tag/git), and [Domains](#tag/domains).

[Web](#tag/web): Send us the code for the website, we'll provision the certificates and get it hosted

[Execute](#tag/execute): Send us a function, we'll run it and send you the output

[Cloudstate](#tag/cloudstate): Our Opensource JavaScript Runtime used for cloud functions with persistent state

[Domains](#tag/domains): Manage your domains, including verification and listing

[Git](#tag/git): Manage your git repositories

get.description: Get a backup of a cloudstate project

post.description:
Provisions a wildcard certificate for a verified domain


This speeds up deploys on all subdomains of the domain. In order to use it, you must add the following record to your DNS config:

`_acme-challenge.yourdomain.com` NS `dns.freestyle.sh`

get.description: List domain mappings for any query based on exact domain or domain ownership (the domain ownership that gave the right to use the domain)

post.description: This will unmap any other deployment to this domain

401.description: You do not have permission to do this

200.description: Successfully removed domain mapping to deployment

401.description: You do not have permission to do this

get.summary: List domain verification requests for an account
get.description: Lists domain verification requests for the current account.

x-codeSamples.label: JS SDK

put.description: This checks a pre-existing verification request for a domain. To create a verification request, call the [create domain verification](/#tag/domains/POST/domains/v1/verifications) endpoint. This endpoint will check if the domain has a TXT record with the verification code. If it does, the domain will be verified.

x-codeSamples.label: JS SDK

post.description: This creates a Freestyle Domain Verification Request. It returns a `verificationCode` for your domain. You need to place this code in a TXT record at `_freestyle_custom_hostname.thedomain.com`, then call the [verify domain](/#tag/domains/PUT/domains/v1/verifications) endpoint with the domain to verify it.

x-codeSamples.label: JS SDK

delete.description: This deletes a Freestyle Domain Verification Request. This does not remove the domain from the account if it has already been verified, however the verification code will no longer be valid.

x-codeSamples.label: JS SDK
Vercel AI SDK
Mastra AI SDK
LangGraph AI SDK
Python SDK
Gemini Python SDK
x-codeSamples.source:
import google.genai as genai
from google.genai import types

import os
import freestyle.gemini

client = genai.Client(api_key=os.environ.get("GENERATIVEAI_API_KEY"))


# model = genai.client.com("gemini-2.0-flash")
definition, runner = freestyle.gemini.execute_tool(
    os.environ.get("FREESTYLE_API_KEY"),
)
chat = client.chats.create(
    model="gemini-2.0-flash",
    config=types.GenerateContentConfigDict(
        tools=[definition],
    ),
    history=[],
)

response = chat.send_message(
    "What is the sum of every number from 50 to 65 divided by 17"
).candidates[0]
tool_result = runner(response.content)

print("Answer: ", tool_result)

x-codeSamples.label: OpenAI Python SDK
x-codeSamples.source:
import os
import openai
import freestyle.openai

client = openai.OpenAI(
    api_key=os.environ.get('OPENAI_API_KEY'),
)


(definition, runner) = freestyle.openai.execute_tool(
    os.environ.get('FREESTYLE_API_KEY'),
)

query = 'What is the sum of every number from 50 to 65 divided by 17'
messages = [{'role': 'user', 'content': query}]
print('Question: ', query)

res = client.chat.completions.create(
    model='gpt-4-turbo', messages=messages, tools=[definition]
)


result = runner(res.choices[0].message)

messages.append(res.choices[0].message)
if len(result) > 0:
    messages.extend(result)

res = client.chat.completions.create(
    model='gpt-4-turbo',
    messages=messages,
    tools=[definition],
)

print('Answer: ', res.choices[0].message.content)

get.description: List Git identities created by your account.

post.description: Create a Git identity. This identity will be used to authenticate with the Git server.

delete.description: Delete a Git identity. This will revoke all permissions granted to this identity.

get.summary: List repository permissions for an identity

parameters.description: Maximum number of repositories to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset for the list of repositories

delete.summary: Revoke permissions from a Git identity

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of repositories to return

parameters.name: offset

post.description:
Create a repository. Once the repository is created, it will also be created on the Git server.
The repository name must be unique within your account.

Once created, you can then push your code to this repository.

The repo will be available at `git.freestyle.sh/{repo-id}`

name.description:
This name is not visible to users, and is only accessible to you via API and in the
dashboard. Mostly useful for observability.

defaultBranch.description: The default branch name for the repository. Defaults to "main" if not specified.

source.description: Fork from another Git repository. Cannot be used with `import`.

import.description: Import static content with an initial commit. Cannot be used with `source`.

get.description: Get the default branch name for a repository.

put.description: Set the default branch name for a repository. This will update the HEAD reference to point to the new default branch.

get.description: Get the GitHub sync configuration for a repository, if configured.

404.description: Repository or sync configuration not found

post.description: Configure GitHub synchronization for an existing Freestyle repository. This links your Freestyle repository to a GitHub repository for automatic syncing. Requires the GitHub repository name in 'owner/repo' format.

delete.description: Remove GitHub sync configuration from a repository. This stops automatic syncing but doesn't affect the repository content.

404.description: Repository or sync configuration not found

get.description: Retrieve information about a specific repository, including its ID, name, and default branch.

delete.description: Delete a repository. This is irreversible, and will also delete the repository on the Git server.

403.description: User does not have permission to delete this repository

get.summary: Get the contents of a file or directory
get.description: Get the contents of a file or directory in a repository

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: The git reference (branch name, commit SHA, etc.). Defaults to HEAD.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to the file or directory. Empty for root.

get.description: Get a blob from the Git database. The contents will always be base64 encoded.
List commits from the Git database for a specific repository and branch.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of commits to return (default: 50, max: 500)

get.description: Get a commit from the Git database with detailed information.
Get a reference to a branch in the Git repository. Returns the ref name and SHA of the branch.
Get a reference to a tag in the Git repository. Returns the ref name and SHA of the tag.
Get a tag from the Git database.
Get a tree from the Git database with its entries.

get.summary: Download a tarball of a repo.
get.description: Download the contents of a repo as a tarball.

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: The git reference (branch name, commit SHA, etc.). Defaults to HEAD.

get.summary: List git triggers for a repository
get.description: List git triggers for the given repository.

403.description: User does not have permission to access this repository

post.description: Create a git trigger for the given repository.

403.description: User does not have permission to create a trigger on this repository

delete.description: Delete a git trigger. This is irreversible.

403.description: User does not have permission to delete a trigger on this repository

get.summary: Download a zip of a repo
get.description: Download the contents of a repo as a zip.

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: The git reference (branch name, commit SHA, etc.). Defaults to HEAD.

get.description: Get the logs for a deployment

get.description: Get information about a web deploy by its ID.

AccessibleRepository.description: Identical to [`RepositoryInfo`], but with the permissions field added.

BlobEncoding.description: The encoding of a blob from the API. Always `base64`.

content.description: The content of the blob, base64 encoded.

encoding.description: The encoding of the blob. Always `base64`.

count.description: Number of commits returned in this page

total.description: Total number of commits available in the branch

tree.description: The ID of the tree pointed to by this commit

githubRepoName.description: The GitHub repository name in "owner/repo" format

files.title: Files
files.description: A map of file names to their contents.

name.description:
This name is not visible to users, and is only accessible to you via API and in the
dashboard. Mostly useful for observability.

defaultBranch.description: The default branch name for the repository. Defaults to "main" if not specified.

source.description: Fork from another Git repository. Cannot be used with `import`.

import.description: Import static content with an initial commit. Cannot be used with `source`.

oneOf.title: Git
oneOf.description: `dir` is the Directory to deploy from. If not provided, the root of the repository will be used.

background.description: Spawn this command as a background process and return immediately

domains.description: ID of the project to deploy, if not provided will create a new project

envVars.description: The environment variables that the cloudstate deploy can access

domain.description: The domain to create a verification code for

entrypoint.description: The entrypoint file for the website, if none is provided, we will try to automatically detect it.

domains.description: The custom domains for the website, eg. [\"subdomain.yourwebsite.com\"]. You may include a single *.style.dev domain here.

projectId.description: Project ID was our original way of tracking deployments together, it is now deprecated and will be removed in the future. Please use the domains field to specify the domains for your project.

nodeModules.description: Node Modules to install for the website, a map of package names to versions, e.g. { \"express\": \"4.17.1\" }. If this and a package-lock.json are provided, the package-lock.json, bun.lockb, pnpm-lock.yaml, or yarn.lock is also provided, the versions here will override the versions in those lock files.

envVars.description:
The environment variables that the website can access
e.g. { \"RESEND_API_KEY\": \"re_123456789\" }

timeout.description: Timeout for the deployment in seconds. If not provided, the default is 10 seconds.

files.description:
The files to deploy, a map of file paths to file contents, e.g. { \"index.js\": {\"content\": \"your main\", \"encoding\": \"utf-8\"}, \"file2.js\": {\"content\": \"your helper\" } }

**Do not include node modules in this bundle, they will not work**. Instead, includes a package-lock.json, bun.lockb, pnpm-lock.yaml, or yarn.lock, the node modules for the project will be installed from that lock file, or use the node_modules field in the configuration to specify the node modules to install.

source.description:
The files to deploy, a map of file paths to file contents, e.g. { \"index.js\": {\"content\": \"your main\", \"encoding\": \"utf-8\"}, \"file2.js\": {\"content\": \"your helper\" } }

**Do not include node modules in this bundle, they will not work**. Instead, includes a package-lock.json, bun.lockb, pnpm-lock.yaml, or yarn.lock, the node modules for the project will be installed from that lock file, or use the node_modules field in the configuration to specify the node modules to install.

entrypoint.description: The entrypoint file for the website. If not specified we try to automatically detect it.

domain.description: The domain to create a verification code for

script.description: The JavaScript or TypeScript script to execute

envVars.description: The environment variables to set for the script

nodeModules.description: The node modules to install for the script

tags.description: Tags for you to organize your scripts, useful for tracking what you're running

peerDependencyResolution.description: If false, we'll not resolve peer dependencies for the packages given, this can speed up execute performance, but will break packages with peers unless the peers are manually specified.

customHeaders.description: These headers will be added to every fetch request made through the script

proxy.description: Proxy all outgoing requests through this URL

result.description: The return value of the default export of the script

encoding.description: The encoding of the file. Either **utf-8** or **base64**

FreestyleVerifyDomainRequest.description: Verify a domain verification request, can either be done for a domain, or for a specific request

sha.description: The hash / object ID of the file.
The hash / object ID of the directory.
The hash / object ID of the file.
The hash / object ID of the directory.

GitReference.description: A reference to a Git object

name.description: The name of the ref (e.g., "refs/heads/main" or "refs/tags/v1.0.0")

sha.description: The SHA-1 hash of the Git object this reference points to

date.description: The date marker for this signature

oneOf.description: The tagger who created the tag

target.description: The object this tag points to

result.description: The return value of the default export of the script

tags.name: Web
tags.description: APIs for deploying websites. We handle node modules caching, scaling, certificates and the whole end to end process. Send the code using the [deploy](#tag/web/POST/web/v1/deploy) endpoint, and you'll get a full hosted website back. Works with any TypeScript or JavaScript codebase.

tags.name: Execute
tags.description: APIs for running code. Send the code using the [execute](#tag/execute/POST/execute/v1/execute) endpoint, and you'll get the output back. Works with any TypeScript or JavaScript code + handles any node modules and environment variables you want.

tags.name: Cloudstate
tags.description: APIs for running cloud functions with persistent state. [Cloudstate](https://github.com/freestyle-sh/cloudstate/) is an opensource, durable JavaScript runtime maintained by the Freestyle Team.

tags.name: Domains
tags.description:
APIs for managing domains. This is only relevant when you want to start to deploy to custom domains. 
Please read [this guide](https://github.com/freestyle-sh/sandbox_sdks/blob/main/docs/custom_domains.md) to understand how deployments work with custom domains.

tags.name: Git
tags.description: APIs for managing git repositories and accessing git objects like commits, trees, blobs, tags, and refs.
